sub_title: Experienced clinical epidemiologist, trialist and cardiometabolic specialist
summary: Diederick (Rick) Grobbee has been a (principal) investigator in many large scale epidemiologic studies and randomized trials of interventions for the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseases. His experience covers the full range of epidemiologic study designs including trials, cohorts and case-control studies. Topics include hypertension, diabetes, risk factors in children and youngsters, coronary heart disease, womenâ€™s health, cardiovascular aging, heart failure and non-invasive vascular imaging. In addition to research on drugs he examined the cardiovascular effects of various nutrients and dietary factors in cohort studies and trials. Apart from his interest in cardiovascular disease he has worked on the theoretical principles and methods of diagnostic and prognostic research.  In 1996 he established the Julius Center at the University Medical Center Utrecht of which he served as a principal director for allmost 15 years. More recently he initiated a global platform for educational exchange, (www.elevatehealth.eu) of which he served as the non-executive director and chair until 2019. In 2011 he started a unit for research on Global Health, a summary of activities is given at www.globalhealth.eu.. He acts as Chief Scientific Officer and statutory director at Julius Clinical Ltd. An Academic Contract Organization established in 2008 as a spin-off of the University Medical Center Utrecht (www.juliusclinical.com). Rick Grobbee was listed in the top 100 global most influential biomedical researchers (Eur J Clin Invest. 2013 Dec;43(12):1339-65). His views on Clinical Epidemiology can be found in Grobbee & Hoes, Clinical Epidemiology (http://www.jblearning.com/catalog/9781449674328/). Rick Grobbee serves on the board of the European Society of Cardiology and chairs its Global Affairs Committee. Rick Grobbee is a fellow of the Royal Dutch Academy of Sciences. He currently acts as the Editor-in-Chief of Global Heart (https://globalheartjournal.com/) the official Journal of the World Heart Federation of which he serves on the board. He supervised over 150 PhD fellows and published more than 1300 scientific papers, chapters and books. Number of international citations (Web of Science) 93,315. Hirsch: h = 163. Google Scolar h = 214. In 2017 he was knighted by the Dutch King (Knight in the Order of the Dutch Lion).
